newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan builders' April orders fall 14.9 pct - group.
newsitem.headline: Japan builders' April orders fall 14.9 pct - group.

text.p: Orders received by major Japanese construction companies in April fell by 14.9 percent from a year earlier to 948.82 billion yen, the Japan Federation of Construction Contractors said on Friday.
"This is the first time since 1988 that the monthly volume of orders fell below one trillion yen," the industry group said in a statement.
"Orders in the first month of the 1997/98 fiscal year (beginning April 1) were at an extremely low level," the group said.
The group's statistics cover its 63 members, all of which are large construction companies.
Private sector orders received by the 63 firms in April fell 17.2 percent year-on-year to 627 billion yen, while public sector orders dropped 11.5 percent to 226 billion yen, the group said.
Overseas orders in April fell 6.1 percent year-on-year to 90 billion yen, the group said.
